intro: Crossandra pinguior, commonly known as the fat crossandra, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that range in color from orange to red. The plant features broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, waxy coating. It thrives in warm, humid environments and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Crossandra pinguior is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
